page.title: 01LANDULPH SCHOOL BLOCK
page.content:
LANDULPH SCHOOL BLOCK, E. CORNWALL.
The block designated for this school consists mainly of agricultural land situated on the west bank of the River Tamar, up river from Saltash. The boundaries of the block extend from the river bank on which is situated the village of Cargreen, to Ellbridge which lies between Saltash and Callington. The land in between is given over to dairy farming and market gardening. The village of Cargreen is a dormitory suburb for the City of Plymouth. The school accommodates approximately 85 children drawn from the villages of Hatt (outside the block) Botus Fleming, Cargreen and other parts of Landulph Parish.
